workplace: Werkstatt / Lösemittel- und Reinigungsarbeiten mit Isopropanol
name: Isopropanol / 2-Propanol / Isopropylalkohol (Art.-Nr. 419364, 419847)
hazard_category: Highly flammable solvent; causes serious eye irritation, narcotic effects; endocrine-active substance
hazards_description: Classified as flammable liquid category 2 with easily flammable liquid and vapour (Flam. Liq. 2, H225, flashpoint 12 °C) and as causing severe eye irritation (Eye Irrit. 2, H319).[attached_file:file:11] May cause drowsiness and dizziness as specific target organ toxicant single exposure (STOT SE 3, H336); vapours are heavier than air, spread along ground and form explosive mixtures with air (explosion limits approx. 2–13.4 vol%). The substance is endocrine-active.[attached_file:file:11]
protective_measures: Avoid inhalation of vapours and contact with eyes and skin; ensure good general ventilation and, where commercially used, local exhaust ventilation and ground-level suction in work areas to keep vapour levels below the workplace limit of 200 ppm (500 mg/m³).[attached_file:file:11] Keep away from heat, hot surfaces, sparks and open flames; do not smoke, implement measures against electrostatic discharge and use only spark-free, non-antistatic tools; store containers tightly closed at 15–25 °C in a cool, well-ventilated location away from incompatible materials.[attached_file:file:11] Wear solvent- and acid-resistant chemical gloves (e.g. nitrile 0.4 mm, chloroprene 0.5 mm, butyl rubber 0.7 mm for long contact; butyl rubber or nitrile 0.1 mm for splash protection), safety goggles/face shield and suitable work clothing; use respiratory protection (filter A-P2) if technical ventilation is insufficient.[attached_file:file:file:11]
emergency_procedures: In case of accidental release, prevent spread by damming and containing the liquid, cover drains, provide adequate ventilation at ground level and keep away from ignition sources.[attached_file:file:11] Absorb spilled material using sand, diatomaceous earth, acid binder or universal binder, collect in suitable closed containers for waste disposal and thoroughly clean contaminated areas; prevent entry into drains, cellars and surface water.[attached_file:file:11] In case of fire, use water mist, alcohol-resistant foam, dry powder (BC powder) or CO₂ (not full water jet); wear self-contained breathing apparatus and chemical protective suit, cool exposed containers with water spray, and collect contaminated extinguishing water separately to prevent environmental pollution.[attached_file:file:11]
emergency_phone_reference: Giftnotdienst der Charité Universitätsmedizin Berlin, 24h: +49 (0)30 30 68 67 00; betriebliche Notrufnummer siehe Aushang.[attached_file:file:11]

first_aid.hautkontakt: Beschmutzte, getränkte Kleidung sofort ausziehen; betroffene Haut sofort mit viel Wasser und Seife waschen und gründlich nachspülen; bei Hautreizungen Arzt aufsuchen.[attached_file:file:11]
first_aid.augenkontakt: Sofort vorsichtig und gründlich mit Augendusche oder fließendem Wasser spülen (mindestens 10–15 Minuten bei geöffnetem Lidspalt); Kontaktlinsen nach Möglichkeit entfernen und weiter spülen; anschließend umgehend Augenarzt aufsuchen.[attached_file:file:11]
first_aid.verschlucken: Betroffene Person sofort trinken lassen; Mund mit reichlich Wasser ausspülen (nur wenn bei Bewusstsein); betroffene Person ruhig lagern, zudecken und warm halten; kein Erbrechen herbeiführen; sofort medizinische Hilfe holen.[attached_file:file:11]
first_aid.einatmen: Betroffene Person an die frische Luft bringen und für ungehinderte Atmung sorgen; bei Atembeschwerden oder Atemstillstand künstliche Beatmung mit Beatmungsbeutel oder Beatmungsgerät (keine Mund-zu-Mund oder Mund-zu-Nasen Beatmung) einleiten; ruhig lagern und ärztliche Hilfe veranlassen.[attached_file:file:11]

first_aider_reference: Ersthelfer sollen auf Selbstschutz achten und Atemschutz sowie chemikalienresistente Handschuhe tragen; bei Bewusstlosigkeit in stabile Seitenlage bringen; bei Atembeschwerden, Verdacht auf Aspiration oder anhaltenden Symptomen immer ärztliche Hilfe bzw. Notarzt hinzuziehen.[attached_file:file:11]
disposal: Do not dispose of with household waste; hand over to authorised hazardous-waste disposers in accordance with local and national regulations (Kreislaufwirtschaftsgesetz KrWG) and Directive 2008/98/EC.[attached_file:file:11] Suggested waste codes: 160506 (unused product and spent product, laboratory chemicals containing hazardous substances) and 150104 (contaminated packaging); completely emptied containers may be recycled; non-cleanable packaging must be disposed of as hazardous waste.[attached_file:file:11]
